comments: "row" is the revered keyword in BIRT to reference the current row of the result set, so user can't re-assign it with any values. I think the tutorial document should be changed.

It makes sense to me that if 'row' is a reserved word in BIRT there might be an error, but I believe there should be a more user friendly error then seeing a stack trace and a generic ScriptEvaluationError.

Does BIRT do some parsing of the JavaScript prior to it being passed to Rhino?  If so, could BIRT throw a more descriptive error?  If not, is there still a way to get better information to the user so the output is less cryptic?

Another suggestion would be to highlight (or somehow differentiate) BIRT reserved words in the script editor, so at least folks would be aware of it up front.

I think the documentation needs to be changed and I will follow up on this, but I would also like to see this bug changed back to the correct component where possibly such a change as I've mentioned above could be made, and not just keep this as only a doc bug.

Consider better error reporting of JS during report design time.  THere is a project to enhance the JS script editor to support debugging.  The scripting error in this bug  (using reserved object name "row") could be a good usage case to support for the JS debugger.   please submit a bug to engine if UI needs engine change to support this enh.

As it needs some more detail design on Engine, Model, UI for JS editor enhancement.
Defer it out of 2.2.
